intro: Schmaltzia trinervata, commonly known as the three-veined Schmaltzia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Schmaltzia trinervata is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and ability to thrive in poor soils.
